sen.j: 淡海国造（おうみのくにのみやつこ・おうみこくぞう)は近江国西部(琵琶湖西岸)を支配した国造。
sen.e: Omi no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi kokuzo) is the kuninomiyatsuko (kokuzo: the head of a local government) who governed the western part of Omi Province (the west coast of Lake Biwa).
Omi no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi kokuzo) was the kuninomiyatsuko (kokuzo: the head of a local government) who governed the western part of Omi Province (the west coast of Lake Biwa).
Omi no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi kokuzo) was the kuninomiyatsuko (kokuzo: the head of a local government) who governed the western part of Omi Province (the west coast of Lake Biwa).

sen.j: 近淡海(ちかつおうみ)国造とも。
sen.e: It is also called Chikatsuomi no kuninomiyatsuko (Chikatsuomi kokuzo).
It is also called Chikatsuomi no kuninomiyatsuko (Chikatsuomi kokuzo).
It is also called Chikatsuomi no kuninomiyatsuko (Chikatsuomi kokuzo).

sen.j: 『古事記』によると祖は天押帯日子で、春日氏・小野氏と同系。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the earliest ancestor is Ameoshitarashihiko (a prince of Emperor Kosho) and it is related to Kasuga clan and Ono clan.
sen.cmt: 知識が無い読者を想定して、天押帯日子が孝昭天皇の皇子であるという情報を補足しました。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the earliest ancestor was Ameoshitarashihiko (a prince of Emperor Kosho) and it was related to the Kasuga clan and the Ono clan.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。is→wasKasuga clan→the Kasuga clanOno clan→the Ono clan
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the earliest ancestor was Ameoshitarashihiko (a prince of Emperor Kosho) and it was related to the Kasuga clan and the Ono clan.

sen.j: 『国造本紀』によると、成務天皇朝に彦坐王3世孫の大陀牟夜別が淡海国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: According to "Kokuzohongi" (The Original Records of Provincial Governors), Otamuyawake, the third descendant of Hikoimasu no Miko (a prince of Emperor Kaika), is said to have been appointed the Omi no kuninomiyatsuko in Seimu Emperor's era.
sen.cmt: 知識が無い読者を想定して、彦坐王が開化天皇の皇子であるという情報を捕捉しました。
sen.e: According to "Kokuzohongi" (The Original Records of Provincial Governors), Otamuyawake, the third descendant of Hikoimasu no Miko (a prince of Emperor Kaika), is said to have been appointed the Omi no kuninomiyatsuko in Seimu Emperor's era.

According to "Kokuzohongi" (The Original Records of Provincial Governors), Otamuyawake, the third descendant of Hikoimasu no Miko (a prince of Emperor Kaika), is said to have been appointed the Omi no kuninomiyatsuko in Seimu Emperor's era.
It is Omi clan.
sen.cmt: 原文は単語のみですが、句点があるので省略のある文であると判断し、文の形になるように補足しました。以下こうした場合には「文にするために省略部分を補足」と記入します。
sen.e: It was the Omi clan.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。is→wasOmi clan→the Omi clanに修正しました。
sen.e: It was the Omi clan.
It is probably related to Ono clan.
sen.cmt: 「同族か」と断定していないが、上の文では「同系。」と言い切っています。そこで、「か」については確率の高いことを示す"probably"を当てることで対応しました。
sen.e: It was probably related to the Ono clan.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。is→wasOno clan→the Ono clanに修正しました。
sen.e: It was probably related to the Ono clan.

sen.j: 淡海三船らは弘文天皇の子孫なので別系。
sen.e: The clan of OMI no Mifune is unrelated because his clan is the descendants of Emperor Kobun.
The clan of OMI no Mifune was unrelated because his clan was the descendants of Emperor Kobun.
The clan of OMI no Mifune was unrelated because his clan was the descendants of Emperor Kobun.
It may be in Siga County, Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 「か」については、どのくらいの可能性かが分からないので、偏らないように"may"としました。
sen.e: It may be in Shiga County, Omi Province.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。Siga→Shiga
sen.e: It may be in Shiga County, Omi Province.

sen.j: 後には琵琶湖東岸の淡海安国造を併合し、近江全体を支配したともいう。
sen.e: It is said to have annexed Omi no Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi no Yasu kokuzo) on the east coast of Lake Biwa afterwards and governed all of Omi Province.
It is said to have annexed Omi no Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi no Yasu kokuzo) on the east coast of Lake Biwa afterwards and governed all of Omi Province.
It is said to have annexed Omi no Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi no Yasu kokuzo) on the east coast of Lake Biwa afterwards and governed all of Omi Province.

tit.e: Ujigami (a guardian god of a clan)
Ujigami (a guardian god of a clan)
Ujigami (a guardian god of a clan)

sen.j: 建部神社 ...... 滋賀県大津市。
sen.e: It is in Takebe Shrine in Otsu City, Siga Prefecture
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: It is in Takebe Shrine in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。Siga→Shigaﾋﾟﾘｵﾄﾞを追加しました。
sen.e: It is in Takebe Shrine in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
The enshrined deity is YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto (.a prince of Emperor Keiko, a hero in ancient Japan).
sen.cmt: 知識の無い読者を想定して、日本武尊の簡単な説明を補足しました。
sen.e: The enshrined deity is YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto (.a prince of Emperor Keiko, a hero in ancient Japan).
The enshrined deity is YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto (.a prince of Emperor Keiko, a hero in ancient Japan).
The shrine is the Ichinomiya (shrine with the highest ranking in the area) of Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: The shrine is the Ichinomiya (shrine with the highest ranking in the area) of Omi Province.
The shrine is the Ichinomiya (shrine with the highest ranking in the area) of Omi Province.

sen.j: 大陀牟夜別 ...... 淡海国造。
sen.e: One of the descendants is Otamuyawake, Omi no kuninomiyatsuko.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: One of the descendants was Otamuyawake, Omi no kuninomiyatsuko.
One of the descendants was Otamuyawake, Omi no kuninomiyatsuko.
He is the earliest ancestor of Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: He was the earliest ancestor of Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko.
He was the earliest ancestor of Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko.
He is the third descendant of Hikoimasu no Miko.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: He was the third descendant of Hikoimasu no Miko.
He was the third descendant of Hikoimasu no Miko.

sen.j: 娘の両道入姫は日本武尊に嫁いで稲依別王を産んだ。
sen.e: His daughter, Futajinoirihime, married YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto and had Inayoriwake no Miko.
sen.cmt: 「古事記」と「日本書紀」では稲依別王の生母は別人です。「古事記」では「布多遅比売（ふたじひめ）」となっており、淡海国造である大陀牟夜別の娘です。「日本書紀」では「布多遅能伊理毘売命（ふたじのいりびめのみこと）」で、こちらは垂仁天皇の皇女です。そして原文の「両道入姫」の字が当てられているのは、調べた限り後者のみでした。大陀牟夜別の娘である「布多遅比売（ふたじひめ）」に「両道入姫（ふたじのいりひめ）」と当てて良いのかは不明です。可能であるなら、原文の著者かこの分野の専門家に確認を取った方が良いと思います。
sen.e: His daughter, Futajinoirihime, married YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto and had Inayoriwake no Miko.
His daughter, Futajinoirihime, married YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto and had Inayoriwake no Miko.

sen.j: 犬上御田鍬 ...... 飛鳥時代の外交官。
sen.e: One of the descendants is INUGAMI no Mitasuki (INUKAMI no Mitasuki), a diplomat in the Asuka Period.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: One of the descendants was INUGAMI no Mitasuki (INUKAMI no Mitasuki), a diplomat in the Asuka Period.
One of the descendants was INUGAMI no Mitasuki (INUKAMI no Mitasuki), a diplomat in the Asuka Period.
He is a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: He was a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China.
He was a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China.
He is the first Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: He was the first Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China.
He was the first Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China.
